blocks.name: chlt
blocks.content: Extend class notation with Hilbert lattices.
blocks.origin: const class chlt { HL }

blocks.name: diff.chlt.s
diff.chlt.c

df-hlat
blocks.content: Define the class of Hilbert lattices, which are complete, atomic lattices satisfying the superposition principle and minimum height. (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2012.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-hlat(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(chlt, crab(s0, cin(cin(coml, ccla), clc), wa(wral(s1, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wral(s2, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wi(wne(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wrex(s3, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), w3a(wne(cv(s3), cv(s1)), wne(cv(s3), cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cjn, cv(s0)), cv(s2)))))))), wrex(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wrex(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wa(wa(wbr(cfv(cp0, cv(s0)), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s2))), wa(wbr(cv(s2), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cplt, cv(s0)), cfv(cp1, cv(s0)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
}

blocks.name: ishlat1
blocks.content: The predicate "is a Hilbert lattice", which is: is orthomodular ( ` K e. OML ` ), complete ( ` K e. CLat ` ), atomic and satisfies the exchange (or covering) property ( ` K e. CvLat ` ), satisfies the superposition principle, and has a minimum height of 4 (witnessed here by 0, x, y, z, 1). (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2012.)

blocks.name: ishlat2
blocks.content: The predicate "is a Hilbert lattice". Here we replace ` K e. CvLat ` with the weaker ` K e. AtLat ` and show the exchange property explicitly. (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2012.)

blocks.name: ishlat3N
blocks.content: The predicate "is a Hilbert lattice". Note that the superposition principle is expressed in the compact form ` E. z e. A ( x .\/ z ) = ( y .\/ z ) ` . The exchange property and atomicity are provided by ` K e. CvLat ` , and "minimum height 4" is shown explicitly. (Contributed by NM, 8-Nov-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.content: De Morgan's law for GLB and LUB. Index-set version of ~ glbconN , where we read ` S ` as ` S ( i ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 17-Jan-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)

  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ HL ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2)∧ ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4))→ c1 ≠ c4)
  ⊣ c5 =(le ` c0)
  ⊣ c6 =(join ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(Atoms ` c0)
} = {
  syl131anc((c0 ∈ HL ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2)∧ ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4)), c1 ≠ c4, c0 ∈ Lat, c1 ∈(Base ` c0), c3 ∈(Base ` c0), c4 ∈(Base ` c0), ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4))
  3ad2ant1(c0 ∈ HL, (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2), ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4), c0 ∈ Lat)
  hllat(c0)
  syl((c0 ∈ HL ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2)∧ ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4)), c1 ∈(Base ` c0), c1 ∈ c2)
  simp21(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ c2, c4 ∈ c2, ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4))
  atbase(c1, c2, (Base ` c0), c0)
  syl((c0 ∈ HL ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2)∧ ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4)), c3 ∈(Base ` c0), c3 ∈ c2)
  simp22(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ c2, c4 ∈ c2, ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4))
  atbase(c3, c2, (Base ` c0), c0)
  syl((c0 ∈ HL ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2)∧ ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4)), c4 ∈(Base ` c0), c4 ∈ c2)
  simp23(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ c2, c4 ∈ c2, ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4))
  atbase(c4, c2, (Base ` c0), c0)
  simp3(c0 ∈ HL, (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2), ¬ c1[c5](c3[c6]c4))
  latnlej1r(c0, c1, (Base ` c0), c3, c4, c5, c6)
  eqid((Base ` c0))
}

blocks.name: hlsupr
blocks.content: A Hilbert lattice has the superposition property. Theorem 13.2 in [Crawley] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 30-Jan-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm hlsupr(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3)), wrex(s0, c2, w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), c4, co(c1, c5, c3)))))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wne(c1, c3), wrex(s0, c2, w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), c4, co(c1, c5, c3)))))
  simpld(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wi(wne(c1, c3), wrex(s0, c2, w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), c4, co(c1, c5, c3))))), wral(s0, cfv(cbs, c0), wi(wa(wn(wbr(c1, c4, cv(s0))), wbr(c1, c4, co(cv(s0), c5, c3))), wbr(c3, c4, co(cv(s0), c5, c1)))))
  hlsuprexch(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cbs, c0)
  diff.cbs.s(s0)
}

thm hlsupr(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ⊢ (((c0 ∈ HL ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2)∧ c1 ≠ c3)→ ∃(s0 ∈ c2,(s0 ≠ c1 ∧ s0 ≠ c3 ∧ s0[c4](c1[c5]c3))))
  ⊣ c4 =(le ` c0)
  ⊣ c5 =(join ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(Atoms ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  imp((c0 ∈ HL ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2), c1 ≠ c3, ∃(s0 ∈ c2,(s0 ≠ c1 ∧ s0 ≠ c3 ∧ s0[c4](c1[c5]c3))))
  simpld((c0 ∈ HL ∧ c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2), (c1 ≠ c3 → ∃(s0 ∈ c2,(s0 ≠ c1 ∧ s0 ≠ c3 ∧ s0[c4](c1[c5]c3)))), ∀(s0 ∈(Base ` c0),((¬ c1[c4]s0 ∧ c1[c4](s0[c5]c3))→ c3[c4](s0[c5]c1))))
  hlsuprexch(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, (Base ` c0))
  eqid((Base ` c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cbs, c0)
  diff.cbs.s(s0)
}

thm hlsupr2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {

} = {
  mpbird(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(co(c1, c4, cv(s0)), co(c3, c4, cv(s0)))), wi(wne(c1, c3), wrex(s0, c2, w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3))))))

  hlsupr(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, cfv(cple, c0), c4)
  bitrd(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(co(c1, c4, cv(s0)), co(c3, c4, cv(s0)))), wi(wne(c1, c3), wrex(s0, c2, w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3))))), wrex(s0, c2, wi(wne(c1, c3), w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3))))))
  rexbidva(s0, c2, w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c4, cv(s0)), co(c3, c4, cv(s0))), wi(wne(c1, c3), w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3)))))
  syl13anc(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wb(wceq(co(c1, c4, cv(s0)), co(c3, c4, cv(s0))), wi(wne(c1, c3), w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3))))), wcel(c0, clc), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c2))
  syl(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c2)), wcel(c0, clc), wcel(c0, chlt))
  simpl1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c2))
  hlcvl(c0)
  simpl2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c2))
  simpl3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(cv(s0), c2))
  simpr(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wcel(cv(s0), c2))
  cvlsupr3(c0, c1, c2, c3, cv(s0), c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cple, c0))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wb(wrex(s0, c2, wi(wne(c1, c3), w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3))))), wi(wne(c1, c3), wrex(s0, c2, w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3)))))), wne(c2, emptycls))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wne(c2, emptycls))
  ne0i(c1, c2)
  r19.37zv(s0, c2, wne(c1, c3), w3a(wne(cv(s0), c1), wne(cv(s0), c3), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(c1, c4, c3))))

  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, chlt)
  diff.chlt.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, c2)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c3, c2)

blocks.name: hlhgt4
blocks.content: A Hilbert lattice has a height of at least 4. (Contributed by NM, 4-Dec-2011.)
blocks.origin:
thm hlhgt4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wrex(s2, c1, wa(wa(wbr(c2, c3, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))), wa(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), c3, c4)))))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cplt, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cp0, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cp1, c0))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {
  sylbi(wcel(c0, chlt), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wrex(s2, c1, wa(wa(wbr(c2, c3, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))), wa(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), c3, c4)))))), wa(w3a(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, ccla), wcel(c0, cal)), wa(wral(s0, cfv(catm, c0), wral(s1, cfv(catm, c0), wa(wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wrex(s2, cfv(catm, c0), w3a(wne(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wne(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s2), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(s0), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(s1)))))), wral(s2, c1, wi(wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(s2))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(s2), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(s1)))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(s2), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(s0)))))))), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wrex(s2, c1, wa(wa(wbr(c2, c3, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))), wa(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), c3, c4)))))))))
  ishlat2(s0, s1, s2, c0, cfv(catm, c0), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cjn, c0), c1, c2, c3, c4)
  eqid(cfv(cple, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cjn, c0))
  eqid(cfv(catm, c0))
  simprr(w3a(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, ccla), wcel(c0, cal)), wral(s0, cfv(catm, c0), wral(s1, cfv(catm, c0), wa(wi(wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wrex(s2, cfv(catm, c0), w3a(wne(cv(s2), cv(s0)), wne(cv(s2), cv(s1)), wbr(cv(s2), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(s0), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(s1)))))), wral(s2, c1, wi(wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(s2))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(s2), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(s1)))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), co(cv(s2), cfv(cjn, c0), cv(s0)))))))), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wrex(s2, c1, wa(wa(wbr(c2, c3, cv(s0)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(s1))), wa(wbr(cv(s1), c3, cv(s2)), wbr(cv(s2), c3, c4)))))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, catm, c0)
  diff.catm.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, catm, c0)
  diff.catm.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, catm, c0)
  diff.catm.s(s2)
}

thm hlhgt4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,((c2[c3]s0 ∧ s0[c3]s1)∧(s1[c3]s2 ∧ s2[c3]c4))))))
  ⊣ c1 =(Base ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 =(lt ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(0. ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(1. ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
} = {
  sylbi(c0 ∈ HL, ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,((c2[c3]s0 ∧ s0[c3]s1)∧(s1[c3]s2 ∧ s2[c3]c4))))), ((c0 ∈ OML ∧ c0 ∈ CLat ∧ c0 ∈ AtLat)∧(∀(s0 ∈(Atoms ` c0), ∀(s1 ∈(Atoms ` c0),((s0 ≠ s1 → ∃(s2 ∈(Atoms ` c0),(s2 ≠ s0 ∧ s2 ≠ s1 ∧ s2[(le ` c0)](s0[(join ` c0)]s1))))∧ ∀(s2 ∈ c1,((¬ s0[(le ` c0)]s2 ∧ s0[(le ` c0)](s2[(join ` c0)]s1))→ s1[(le ` c0)](s2[(join ` c0)]s0))))))∧ ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,((c2[c3]s0 ∧ s0[c3]s1)∧(s1[c3]s2 ∧ s2[c3]c4))))))))
  ishlat2(s0, s1, s2, c0, (Atoms ` c0), (le ` c0), (join ` c0), c1, c2, c3, c4)
  eqid((le ` c0))
  eqid((join ` c0))
  eqid((Atoms ` c0))
  simprr((c0 ∈ OML ∧ c0 ∈ CLat ∧ c0 ∈ AtLat), ∀(s0 ∈(Atoms ` c0), ∀(s1 ∈(Atoms ` c0),((s0 ≠ s1 → ∃(s2 ∈(Atoms ` c0),(s2 ≠ s0 ∧ s2 ≠ s1 ∧ s2[(le ` c0)](s0[(join ` c0)]s1))))∧ ∀(s2 ∈ c1,((¬ s0[(le ` c0)]s2 ∧ s0[(le ` c0)](s2[(join ` c0)]s1))→ s1[(le ` c0)](s2[(join ` c0)]s0)))))), ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, ∃(s2 ∈ c1,((c2[c3]s0 ∧ s0[c3]s1)∧(s1[c3]s2 ∧ s2[c3]c4))))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, catm, c0)
  diff.catm.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, catm, c0)
  diff.catm.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s2, catm, c0)
  diff.catm.s(s2)
}

  syl(wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wcel(c2, c1), wcel(c0, cops))
  op0cl(c0, c2, c1)

  syl13anc(wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wi(wa(wbr(cv(s0), c3, cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs1), c3, c4)), wbr(cv(s0), c3, c4)), wcel(c0, cpo), wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wcel(c4, c1))

  simpr(wa(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))

blocks.name: hlatmstcOLDN
blocks.content: An atomic, complete, orthomodular lattice is atomistic i.e. every element is the join of the atoms under it. See remark before Proposition 1 in [Kalmbach] p. 140; also remark in [BeltramettiCassinelli] p. 98. ( ~ hatomistici analog.) (Contributed by NM, 21-Oct-2011.) (New usage is discouraged.)

thm hlatmstcOLDN(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(club, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(catm, c0))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
} = {
  sylan(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(cfv(c3, crab(s0, c4, wbr(cv(s0), c5, c1))), c1), w3a(wcel(c0, coml), wcel(c0, ccla), wcel(c0, cal)))
  hlomcmat(c0)
  atlatmstc(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5)
}

  ⊣ c2 =(Base ` c0)
  ⊣ c5 =(le ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 =(lub ` c0)
  ⊣ c4 =(Atoms ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, c5)
} = {
  sylan(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ∈ c2, (c3 ` { s0 ∈ c4 | s0[c5]c1 })= c1, (c0 ∈ OML ∧ c0 ∈ CLat ∧ c0 ∈ AtLat))

  latnle(c0, c1, c2, cv(s0), c7, c4, c6)

  imp(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wbr(c1, c4, c3), wbr(c1, c7, c3))

blocks.name: exatleN
blocks.content: A condition for an atom to be less than or equal to a lattice element. Part of proof of Lemma A in [Crawley] p. 112. (Contributed by NM, 28-Apr-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:

  syl(w3a(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2)), w3a(wcel(c3, c4), wcel(c5, c4), wcel(c6, c4)), w3a(wbr(c3, c7, c1), wn(wbr(c5, c7, c1)), wbr(c6, c7, co(c3, c8, c5)))), wne(c6, c3), wbr(c6, c7, c1)), wcel(c6, c2), wcel(c6, c4))

thm hl2at(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {

  -| diffsc(s1, c0)

  mpd(wcel(c0, chlt), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wrex(hs0, cfv(cbs, c0), wa(wbr(cfv(cp0, c0), cfv(cplt, c0), cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cplt, c0), cfv(cp1, c0)))))

  syl6(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0))), wa(wbr(cfv(cp0, c0), cfv(cplt, c0), cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cplt, c0), cfv(cp1, c0))), wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wa(wrex(s0, c1, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp0, c0))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0)))), wrex(s1, c1, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp1, c0))))))
  anim12d(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0))), wbr(cfv(cp0, c0), cfv(cplt, c0), cv(hs0)), wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cplt, c0), cfv(cp1, c0)), wrex(s0, c1, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp0, c0))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0)))), wrex(s1, c1, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp1, c0)))))
  syl3anc(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0))), wi(wbr(cfv(cp0, c0), cfv(cplt, c0), cv(hs0)), wrex(s0, c1, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp0, c0))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))))), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cfv(cp0, c0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(cfv(cp0, c0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c0, cops))
  op0cl(c0, cfv(cp0, c0), cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cp0, c0))
  simpr(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)))
  hlrelat1(s0, c0, cfv(cp0, c0), cfv(cbs, c0), cv(hs0), cfv(cplt, c0), c1, cfv(cple, c0))
  mpd3an3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wi(wbr(cv(hs0), cfv(cplt, c0), cfv(cp1, c0)), wrex(s1, c1, wa(wn(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp1, c0))))), wcel(cfv(cp1, c0), cfv(cbs, c0)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(cv(hs0), cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(cfv(cp1, c0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c0, cops))

  reximi(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wa(wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp0, c0))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wa(wn(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp1, c0))))), wrex(s1, c1, wne(cv(s0), cv(s1))))
  reximi(s1, c1, wa(wa(wn(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp0, c0))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wa(wn(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp1, c0)))), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  ad2ant2lr(wn(wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp0, c0))), wbr(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0)), wn(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp1, c0)), wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  nbrne2(cv(s0), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0), cv(s1))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, chlt))
  diff.hs0.w(wrex(s0, c1, wrex(s1, c1, wne(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cp0, c0)

  diff.cp1.s(s1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))), wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp1, c0)))
  diff.wn.s(s0, wbr(cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0)))
  diff.wbr.s(s0, cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, cv(s1), cfv(cple, c0), cfv(cp1, c0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)

thm hl2at(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ s1)))
  ⊣ c1 =(Atoms ` c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
} = {
  mpd(c0 ∈ HL, ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ s1)), ∃(hs0 ∈(Base ` c0),((0. ` c0)[(lt ` c0)]hs0 ∧ hs0[(lt ` c0)](1. ` c0))))
  hlhgt2(hs0, c0, (Base ` c0), (0. ` c0), (lt ` c0), (1. ` c0))
  rexlimdva(hs0, (Base ` c0), c0 ∈ HL, ((0. ` c0)[(lt ` c0)]hs0 ∧ hs0[(lt ` c0)](1. ` c0)), ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ s1)))
  syl6((c0 ∈ HL ∧ hs0 ∈(Base ` c0)), ((0. ` c0)[(lt ` c0)]hs0 ∧ hs0[(lt ` c0)](1. ` c0)), ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ s1)), (∃(s0 ∈ c1,(¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0)∧ s0[(le ` c0)]hs0))∧ ∃(s1 ∈ c1,(¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0 ∧ s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0)))))
  anim12d((c0 ∈ HL ∧ hs0 ∈(Base ` c0)), (0. ` c0)[(lt ` c0)]hs0, hs0[(lt ` c0)](1. ` c0), ∃(s0 ∈ c1,(¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0)∧ s0[(le ` c0)]hs0)), ∃(s1 ∈ c1,(¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0 ∧ s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0))))
  syl3anc((c0 ∈ HL ∧ hs0 ∈(Base ` c0)), ((0. ` c0)[(lt ` c0)]hs0 → ∃(s0 ∈ c1,(¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0)∧ s0[(le ` c0)]hs0))), c0 ∈ HL, (0. ` c0)∈(Base ` c0), hs0 ∈(Base ` c0))
  simpl(c0 ∈ HL, hs0 ∈(Base ` c0))
  syl((c0 ∈ HL ∧ hs0 ∈(Base ` c0)), (0. ` c0)∈(Base ` c0), c0 ∈ OP)
  op0cl(c0, (0. ` c0), (Base ` c0))
  eqid((0. ` c0))
  simpr(c0 ∈ HL, hs0 ∈(Base ` c0))
  hlrelat1(s0, c0, (0. ` c0), (Base ` c0), hs0, (lt ` c0), c1, (le ` c0))
  mpd3an3(c0 ∈ HL, hs0 ∈(Base ` c0), (hs0[(lt ` c0)](1. ` c0)→ ∃(s1 ∈ c1,(¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0 ∧ s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0)))), (1. ` c0)∈(Base ` c0))
  syl((c0 ∈ HL ∧ hs0 ∈(Base ` c0)), (1. ` c0)∈(Base ` c0), c0 ∈ OP)
  adantr(c0 ∈ HL, hs0 ∈(Base ` c0), c0 ∈ OP)
  hlop(c0)
  op1cl(c0, (1. ` c0), (Base ` c0))
  eqid((1. ` c0))
  hlrelat1(s1, c0, hs0, (Base ` c0), (1. ` c0), (lt ` c0), c1, (le ` c0))
  eqid((Base ` c0))
  eqid((le ` c0))
  eqid((lt ` c0))
  sylbir((∃(s0 ∈ c1,(¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0)∧ s0[(le ` c0)]hs0))∧ ∃(s1 ∈ c1,(¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0 ∧ s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0)))), ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ s1)), ∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1,((¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0)∧ s0[(le ` c0)]hs0)∧(¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0 ∧ s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0))))))
  reeanv(s0, s1, c1, c1, (¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0)∧ s0[(le ` c0)]hs0), (¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0 ∧ s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0)))
  reximi(s0, c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1,((¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0)∧ s0[(le ` c0)]hs0)∧(¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0 ∧ s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0)))), ∃(s1 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ s1))
  reximi(s1, c1, ((¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0)∧ s0[(le ` c0)]hs0)∧(¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0 ∧ s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0))), s0 ≠ s1)
  ad2ant2lr(¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0), s0[(le ` c0)]hs0, ¬ s1[(le ` c0)]hs0, s1[(le ` c0)](1. ` c0), s0 ≠ s1)
  nbrne2(s0, (le ` c0), hs0, s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c((Base ` c0))
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ HL)
  diff.hs0.w(∃(s0 ∈ c1, ∃(s1 ∈ c1, s0 ≠ s1)))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cp0, c0)
  diff.cp0.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cbs, c0)
  diff.cbs.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cbs, c0)
  diff.cbs.s(s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cp1, c0)
  diff.cp1.s(s1)

  diff.wn.s(s0, s1[(le ` c0)]hs0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, s1, (le ` c0), hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.wbr.s(s0, s1, (le ` c0), (1. ` c0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cple, c0)
  diff.cple.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, cp1, c0)
  diff.cp1.s(s0)
  diff.wa.s(s1, ¬ s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0), s0[(le ` c0)]hs0)
  diff.wn.s(s1, s0[(le ` c0)](0. ` c0))
  diff.wbr.s(s1, s0, (le ` c0), (0. ` c0))
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cp0, c0)
  diff.cp0.s(s1)
  diff.wbr.s(s1, s0, (le ` c0), hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cple, c0)
  diff.cple.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)

blocks.name: atex
blocks.content: At least one atom exists. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jul-2012.)
blocks.origin:
thm atex(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, chlt), wne(c1, emptycls))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(catm, c0))
} = {
  sylibr(wcel(c0, chlt), wne(c1, emptycls), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  syl(wcel(c0, chlt), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(hs0, c1, wrex(hs1, c1, wne(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  hl2at(hs0, hs1, c0, c1)
  sylbi(wrex(hs0, c1, wrex(hs1, c1, wne(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wex(hs0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wrex(hs1, c1, wne(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))
  df-rex(hs0, c1, wrex(hs1, c1, wne(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  exsimpl(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wrex(hs1, c1, wne(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  n0(hs0, c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm atex(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ HL → c1 ≠ ∅)
  ⊣ c1 =(Atoms ` c0)
} = {
  sylibr(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ≠ ∅, ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c1))
  syl(c0 ∈ HL, ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c1), ∃(hs0 ∈ c1, ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 ≠ hs1)))
  hl2at(hs0, hs1, c0, c1)
  sylbi(∃(hs0 ∈ c1, ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 ≠ hs1)), ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c1), ∃(hs0,(hs0 ∈ c1 ∧ ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 ≠ hs1))))
  df-rex(hs0, c1, ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 ≠ hs1))
  exsimpl(hs0, hs0 ∈ c1, ∃(hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 ≠ hs1))
  n0(hs0, c1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c1)
}

blocks.name: intnatN
blocks.content: If the intersection with a non-majorizing element is an atom, the intersecting element is not an atom. (Contributed by NM, 26-Jun-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm intnatN(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wa(wn(wbr(c3, c4, c1)), wcel(co(c1, c5, c3), c6))), wn(wcel(c3, c6)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cple, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cmee, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(catm, c0))
} = {
  impr(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wbr(c3, c4, c1)), wcel(co(c1, c5, c3), c6), wn(wcel(c3, c6)))
  syld(wa(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)), wn(wbr(c3, c4, c1))), wcel(co(c1, c5, c3), c6), wn(wcel(c3, c6)), wne(co(c1, c5, c3), cfv(cp0, c0)))

blocks.name: cvr1
blocks.content: A Hilbert lattice has the covering property. Proposition 1(ii) in [Kalmbach] p. 140 (and its converse). ( ~ chcv1 analog.) (Contributed by NM, 17-Nov-2011.)

blocks.name: cvrexch
blocks.content: A Hilbert lattice satisfies the exchange axiom. Proposition 1(iii) of [Kalmbach] p. 140 and its converse. Originally proved by Garrett Birkhoff in 1933. ( ~ cvexchi analog.) (Contributed by NM, 18-Nov-2011.)
blocks.origin:

  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cmee, c0))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(ccvr, c0))
} = {

  breq1d(cfv(cfv(coc, c0), co(c1, c6, c3)), c5, cfv(cfv(coc, c0), c1), co(cfv(cfv(coc, c0), c3), c4, cfv(cfv(coc, c0), c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2)))

blocks.name: cvrat
blocks.content: A nonzero Hilbert lattice element less than the join of two atoms is an atom. ( ~ atcvati analog.) (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-2011.)
blocks.origin:

  simplr1(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3), wcel(c5, c3), wbr(c2, c7, c5))
  simplr3(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3), wcel(c5, c3), wbr(c2, c7, c5))

blocks.name: atexchltN
blocks.content: Atom exchange property. Version of ~ hlatexch2 with less-than ordering. (Contributed by NM, 7-Feb-2012.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm atexchltN(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), wne(c1, c4)), wi(wbr(c1, c5, co(c3, c6, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, co(c1, c6, c4))))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cplt, c0))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cjn, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(catm, c0))
} = {
  3imtr4d(w3a(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), wne(c1, c4)), wbr(c1, c5, co(c3, c6, c4)), wbr(c3, c5, co(c1, c6, c4)), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c3, c6, c4)), wbr(c3, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c4)))
  atexchcvrN(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, cfv(ccvr, c0), c6)
  3adant3(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), wne(c1, c4), wb(wbr(c1, c5, co(c3, c6, c4)), wbr(c1, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c3, c6, c4))))
  atltcvr(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, cfv(ccvr, c0))
  3adant3(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)), wne(c1, c4), wb(wbr(c3, c5, co(c1, c6, c4)), wbr(c3, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c4))))
  syl13anc(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2))), wb(wbr(c3, c5, co(c1, c6, c4)), wbr(c3, cfv(ccvr, c0), co(c1, c6, c4))), wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c4, c2))
  simpl(wcel(c0, chlt), w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2)))
  simpr2(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2))
  simpr1(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2))
  simpr3(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wcel(c4, c2))
  atltcvr(c0, c3, c2, c1, c4, c5, c6, cfv(ccvr, c0))
  eqid(cfv(ccvr, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm atexchltN(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ HL ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2)∧ c1 ≠ c4)→(c1[c5](c3[c6]c4)→ c3[c5](c1[c6]c4)))
  ⊣ c5 =(lt ` c0)
  ⊣ c6 =(join ` c0)
  ⊣ c2 =(Atoms ` c0)
} = {
  3imtr4d((c0 ∈ HL ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2)∧ c1 ≠ c4), c1[c5](c3[c6]c4), c3[c5](c1[c6]c4), c1[(<o ` c0)](c3[c6]c4), c3[(<o ` c0)](c1[c6]c4))
  atexchcvrN(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, (<o ` c0), c6)
  3adant3(c0 ∈ HL, (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2), c1 ≠ c4, (c1[c5](c3[c6]c4)↔ c1[(<o ` c0)](c3[c6]c4)))
  atltcvr(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, c6, (<o ` c0))
  3adant3(c0 ∈ HL, (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2), c1 ≠ c4, (c3[c5](c1[c6]c4)↔ c3[(<o ` c0)](c1[c6]c4)))
  syl13anc((c0 ∈ HL ∧(c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2)), (c3[c5](c1[c6]c4)↔ c3[(<o ` c0)](c1[c6]c4)), c0 ∈ HL, c3 ∈ c2, c1 ∈ c2, c4 ∈ c2)
  simpl(c0 ∈ HL, (c1 ∈ c2 ∧ c3 ∈ c2 ∧ c4 ∈ c2))
  simpr2(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ c2, c4 ∈ c2)
  simpr1(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ c2, c4 ∈ c2)
  simpr3(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ∈ c2, c3 ∈ c2, c4 ∈ c2)
  atltcvr(c0, c3, c2, c1, c4, c5, c6, (<o ` c0))
  eqid((<o ` c0))
}

blocks.name: cvrat4
blocks.content: A condition implying existence of an atom with the properties shown. Lemma 3.2.20 in [PtakPulmannova] p. 68. Also Lemma 9.2(delta) in [MaedaMaeda] p. 41. ( ~ atcvat4i analog.) (Contributed by NM, 30-Nov-2011.)

blocks.content: A Hilbert lattice, whose height is at least 4, has a chain of 4 successively covering atom joins. (Contributed by NM, 3-May-2012.)

blocks.name: ps-1
blocks.content: The join of two atoms ` R .\/ S ` (specifying a projective geometry line) is determined uniquely by any two atoms (specifying two points) less than or equal to that join. Part of Lemma 16.4 of [MaedaMaeda] p. 69, showing projective space postulate PS1 in [MaedaMaeda] p. 67. (Contributed by NM, 15-Nov-2011.)

blocks.name: ps-2
blocks.content: Lattice analogue for the projective geometry axiom, "if a line intersects two sides of a triangle at different points then it also intersects the third side." Projective space condition PS2 in [MaedaMaeda] p. 68 and part of Theorem 16.4 in [MaedaMaeda] p. 69. (Contributed by NM, 1-Dec-2011.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: 3at
blocks.content: Any three non-colinear atoms in a (lattice) plane determine the plane uniquely. This is the 2-dimensional analogue of ~ ps-1 for lines and ~ 4at for volumes. I could not find this proof in the literature on projective geometry (where it is either given as an axiom or stated as an unproved fact), but it is similar to Theorem 15 of Veblen, "The Foundations of Geometry" (1911), p. 18, which uses different axioms. This proof was written before I became aware of Veblen's, and it is possible that a shorter proof could be obtained by using Veblen's proof for hints. (Contributed by NM, 23-Jun-2012.)
blocks.origin:
